instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4929: What is 820-4929? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
This <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on. It starts and boots normally but after the bar under the apple logo has reached ~50% it gets really slow. If i wait a few minutes the bar completes but it stays at the apple screen forever. The customer provided a picture of an error message. This includes the message

AppleUSBHostPort::InterruptOccurred: overcurrent detected

and other (for mee) confusing numbers. There was a little bit of flux by <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> but besides this and a warranty sticker the board looks fine. It also shows the same behaviour when i try to boot from a USB drive. I have no idea where to start on this one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: Check if BIOS chip was ever touched. Run diagnostic by holding down D and powering up.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: Bios chip looks like new. Diagnostic gives me 2 warnings. The battery should be serviced and there may be a problem with the fan - even if the fan is working fine...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: Tried new battery? That will cause it

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: Same thing with battery unplugged. It also needs really long (~30 sec.) after i turn it on until it "dongs"

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: Yes an unplugged battery will cause it to run slow indeed!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: ok, thank you. I had no idea as this is not the case with the older boards... I ordered a battery for this one as i have no one here because they are still pretty expensive...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: New battery arrived today but no change. I also still get the Battery warning if i run diagnostic. The battery i ordered was 100â‚¬ and from a vendor i know and trust so i think ist pretty unlikely that the new battery is also bad.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: Battery warning is common and usually does not have any effect on performance. Can the machine boot from only the battery?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: Yes it works just from battery but also slow...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
Is the only error reported in the onboard test the battery one? How does the battery report in OSX or does this not boot into OSX at all?

Only other thing I can think of is corrupted ME region. Read the original chip and post the dump here.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: It also says that there may be an error with the fan - but fan works normally as far as i can tell. The problem is that it never finishes loading. If its off and i press the power button it needs around 30 sec. to chime. Then the apple loads normally up to ~50% and from there on it loads really slow until the bar under the apple is full. But it never finishes loading. It stays in the Bootscreen with the full bar under the apple. Should i try new Bios to see if something changes?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
Try a BIOS with a clean ME region. Make sure to backup your original!

Here is BIOS with clean ME, only for testing though, need original so that can be fixed.
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=0ByfhQ_x0v-tZRl82MVBFelVtTDQ[/url]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
I removed and saved the old Bios. After that i took a Bios IC from a china board, erased it and programmed the file you send me to it. Now the device boots up normal. I also uploaded the Bios File from the original IC here.

[URL="https://deref-gmx.net/mail/client/hi2cN-e_9lg/dereferrer/?redirectUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fdrive.google.com%2Ffile%2Fd%2F0B5EhUh5agFcuU3E1WFdLek9rbUo3OHZPY3BqYmpDYmxHZFY0%2Fview"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B5EhUh5agFcuU3E1WFdLek9rbUo3OHZPY3BqYmpDYmxHZFY0/view[/URL]

Unfortunately one USB Port is not working and its J4600. So the warning from the beginning

"AppleUSBHostPort::InterruptOccurred: overcurrent detected"

the customer told me about was really a board issue. Could this kill the BIOS?
In guest mode it once gave me the warning that i should unplug the USB device that is draving to much power. But there is nothing plugged in to J4600. The port looks fine and i get 5.16V at Pin 1.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
Download link does not work.

USB over current has nothing to do with the BIOS. Check all 4 USB current sense input to the PCH at <SIGNAL>XDP_USB_EXTA_OC_L</SIGNAL> same for EXTB,EXTC,EXTD. One of them will be low

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message:
I have no idea why but the link only works if you copy it and paste it manually in the browser. Sorry about that.

is  pulsing between 0.9 V and 1.3 V
<SIGNAL>XDP_USB_EXTB_OC_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3 V
<SIGNAL>XDP_USB_EXTC_OC_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3 V
<SIGNAL>XDP_USB_EXTD_OC_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3 V

As i was measuring i found what is shown in the attached picture. Seems like someone else messed with it before... <RESISTOR>R1580</RESISTOR> (<SIGNAL>XDP_USB_EXTA_OC_L</SIGNAL>) is one of the resistors in the picrure...So i fixet that mess, run a jumper, put a missing resistor back on and J4600 is working again. THANK you very much! So if it gets back its original Bios this one should be fixed!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: Will upload BIOS later tonight, stand by.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4929</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> running slow
threads.message: Thank you. This one works perfektly now even with the old IC.
